items.prompt: Your ______ salary is the money you earn before taxes.
items.explanation: El salario bruto (gross salary) es el total antes de que se resten los impuestos.

items.prompt: I receive my ______ every month to see my salary details.
items.explanation: La nómina (payslip) es el documento donde ves los detalles de tu sueldo.

items.prompt: You ______ pay your taxes on time to avoid fines.
items.explanation: Pagar impuestos es una obligación legal, por eso usamos 'have to'.

items.prompt: If you want to save money, you ______ spend all your salary.
items.explanation: Es un consejo negativo: no deberías gastar todo tu sueldo.

items.prompt: My ______ salary is what I actually see in my bank account.
items.explanation: El salario neto (net salary) es lo que recibes después de impuestos.

items.prompt: Employees ________ to pay income tax in most countries.
items.explanation: Usamos 'have to' para expresar una obligación legal.

items.prompt: You ________ check your payslip for any errors every month.
items.explanation: Es un buen consejo (should) revisar la nómina mensualmente.

items.prompt: Order the words: have / to / You / pay / taxes
items.explanation: Sujeto + have to + verbo + objeto.

items.prompt: Income ______ is the money the government takes from your salary.
items.explanation: El impuesto sobre la renta se llama 'income tax'.

items.prompt: He got a ______ because he worked very hard this year.
items.explanation: Un 'bonus' es una paga extra o gratificación por el trabajo.

items.prompt: Does she ________ to pay taxes in this country?
items.explanation: En preguntas con 'Does', usamos la forma base 'have to'.

items.prompt: You ______ save 10% of your net salary every month.
items.explanation: Es un consejo financiero, por eso usamos 'should'.

items.prompt: Order the words: should / check / gross / You / salary / the
items.sentence: You should check the gross salary
items.explanation: Sujeto + should + verbo + objeto.

items.prompt: A ______ is a fixed amount of money you get every month.
items.explanation: Un 'salary' suele ser una cantidad fija mensual.

items.prompt: We ________ not spend more than we earn.
items.explanation: 'Should not' (o shouldn't) se usa para dar consejos negativos.

items.prompt: I don't understand my ______. Where is the tax deduction?
items.explanation: Las deducciones e impuestos se detallan en la nómina (payslip).

items.prompt: Order the words: contract / to / sign / have / the / I
items.sentence: I have to sign the contract
items.explanation: Sujeto + have to + verbo + objeto.

items.prompt: The company ______ pay the employees on the last day of the month.
items.explanation: Es una obligación contractual, usamos 'has to' para la empresa.

items.prompt: The ________ salary is always lower than the gross salary.
items.explanation: El salario neto siempre es menor tras los impuestos.

items.prompt: You ______ pay a lot of taxes if your salary is very high.
items.explanation: Es una obligación legal proporcional al ingreso.

items.prompt: Order the words: shouldn't / your / lose / You / payslip
items.explanation: Sujeto + shouldn't + verbo + objeto.

items.prompt: Gross salary minus taxes equals ________ salary.
items.explanation: El resultado final tras las deducciones es el sueldo neto.

items.prompt: Do you ______ pay for your own health insurance?
items.explanation: En preguntas con 'Do you', se usa 'have to' para obligaciones.

items.prompt: You ________ ask for a pay rise if you work hard.
items.explanation: Es una sugerencia o consejo razonable.

items.prompt: I'm happy because I got a Christmas ______ this year.
items.explanation: La gratificación de Navidad es un 'bonus'.

items.prompt: Order the words: tax / have / I / pay / Do / to / ?
items.sentence: Do I have to pay tax?
items.explanation: Estructura de pregunta: Auxiliar + Sujeto + have to + verbo.

items.prompt: We ______ waste our money on things we don't really need.
items.explanation: Consejo financiero: no deberíamos (shouldn't) malgastar dinero.

items.prompt: The ________ salary is the total before any deductions.
items.explanation: El salario bruto es el total inicial sin descuentos.

items.prompt: You ______ tell the bank if you change your home address.
items.explanation: Es un consejo importante por seguridad y comunicación.

items.prompt: Order the words: taxes / The / build / hospitals / pay / for
items.explanation: Sujeto + verbo + complemento.

items.prompt: The government uses our ______ to build roads and schools.
items.explanation: Los impuestos (taxes) financian la infraestructura pública.

items.prompt: I ________ to pay my rent on the first day of every month.
items.explanation: Pagar el alquiler es una obligación (have to).

items.prompt: My ______ is 2,000 euros, but I only receive 1,600.
items.explanation: Si recibes menos de la cifra nominal, esa cifra es el bruto.

items.prompt: Order the words: should / for / future / save / You / the
items.sentence: You should save for the future
items.explanation: Consejo financiero estándar.

items.prompt: Do you ______ work on weekends in your current job?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre obligaciones laborales.

items.prompt: You don't ________ to pay for this service; it is free.
items.explanation: 'Don't have to' indica que no hay obligación.

items.prompt: A ______ is usually paid weekly or according to hours worked.
items.explanation: 'Wage' suele referirse al pago por horas o semanas.

items.prompt: Order the words: work / to / have / doesn't / today / He
items.sentence: He doesn't have to work today
items.explanation: Indica ausencia de obligación.

items.prompt: You ______ talk to a financial advisor if you have many debts.
items.explanation: Es una sugerencia profesional (should).

items.prompt: I need a copy of my ________ for the bank loan application.
items.explanation: El banco pide la nómina (payslip) como garantía.

items.prompt: The total amount of money you earn is your ______ income.
items.explanation: El ingreso total antes de descuentos es 'gross income'.

items.prompt: Order the words: compare / bank / You / should / accounts
items.explanation: Consejo para elegir la mejor opción.

items.prompt: In some jobs, you ______ wear a uniform for safety.
items.explanation: Si es una norma del trabajo, es una obligación (have to).

items.prompt: We ________ to pay our bills before the deadline.
items.explanation: Pagar facturas es una obligación (have to).

items.prompt: You ______ use a credit card if you cannot pay it back later.
items.explanation: Consejo preventivo para evitar deudas.

items.prompt: Order the words: my / is / net / My / salary / account / in
items.sentence: My net salary is in my account
items.explanation: El salario neto es lo que se deposita finalmente.

items.prompt: If you don't pay your ______, you might face legal consequences.
items.explanation: El impago de impuestos (taxes) es un delito.

items.prompt: Does he ________ to go to the office every day?
items.explanation: Estructura de pregunta con 'Does ... have to'.

items.prompt: You ______ always read the small print in any contract.
items.explanation: Es un consejo de precaución fundamental.

items.prompt: Order the words: want / higher / I / a / salary
items.explanation: Deseo común de mejora económica.

items.prompt: Is your ______ salary enough to cover all your expenses?
items.explanation: El salario neto (net) es lo disponible para gastos.

items.prompt: Many people ______ to pay social security contributions.
items.explanation: Es una obligación (have to).

items.prompt: I get my ________ by email every month.
items.explanation: La nómina electrónica es muy común.

items.prompt: He ________ save money for his retirement.
items.explanation: Es un consejo prudente para el futuro.

items.prompt: Order the words: gross / My / is / salary / 3000 / euros
items.explanation: Cifra total antes de impuestos.

items.prompt: The ______ rate changed this year.
items.explanation: El tipo o tasa impositiva (tax rate).

items.prompt: You ______ spend more than your monthly income.
items.explanation: Consejo básico de economía personal.

items.prompt: We ________ to sign the new agreement tomorrow.
items.explanation: Obligación de firmar (have to).

items.prompt: You ________ not pay anything today.
items.explanation: 'Don't have to' indica que no es obligatorio pagar.

items.prompt: Order the words: high / pay / We / taxes
items.explanation: Sujeto + verbo + objeto.

items.prompt: What is 'payslip' in Spanish?
items.explanation: La nómina es el recibo de salarios.

items.prompt: What is 'gross' in terms of salary?
items.explanation: El salario bruto es el total sin deducciones.

items.prompt: Income tax is a ________ deduction.
items.explanation: Es una deducción obligatoria por ley.

items.prompt: Does she ________ a bonus every year?
items.explanation: Pregunta simple sobre recibir un bono.

items.prompt: Order the words: have / I / taxes / pay / to
items.explanation: Obligación personal.

items.prompt: You ______ check your bank balance frequently.
items.explanation: Es un buen hábito sugerido (should).

items.prompt: The ______ for the late payment was 50 euros.
items.explanation: Una 'fine' es una multa por retraso.

items.prompt: You ________ (not) forget to include your tax ID.
items.explanation: Consejo negativo: no deberías olvidar.

items.prompt: We ________ to follow the company rules.
items.explanation: Obligación de seguir las normas.

items.prompt: Order the words: is / net / This / my / salary
items.explanation: Identificación del sueldo final.

items.prompt: An ______ is someone who manages taxes.
items.explanation: Un contable (accountant) gestiona los impuestos.

items.prompt: I need to file my ______ return.
items.explanation: La declaración de impuestos es la 'tax return'.

items.prompt: Match the terms with their meanings:
items.explanation: Términos financieros clave.

items.prompt: You ________ better save some money.
items.explanation: Forma de dar un consejo fuerte.

items.prompt: Is the tax ______ automatically from your salary?
items.explanation: Los impuestos suelen ser deducidos (deducted) directamente.
